title: fan_print
body: When there are [[fan|fans]] printed on any article of clothing. Do not mistake with [[print fan]].

title: money_slap
body:
Someone getting slapping with [[banknote]]s.
In Japan, there is an idiom, "slap someone on the cheek with a wad of cash," which means "to make someone do what you want with money."

title: euro_sign
body:
The € symbol, used to represent the European Union's currency.

h4. See also

* [[money]]
* [[Tag group:Symbols]]

title: money_bag
body: A cartoonish [[bag]] of [[money]]. Usually takes the appearance of a canvas [[sack]] with a [[dollar sign]] on front.

title: dollar_sign
body:
The [i]dollar sign[/i], also known as the [i]peso sign[/i], is a currency symbol consisting of a capital "S" crossed with one or two vertical strokes, used to indicate the unit of various currencies around the world, including most currencies denominated "peso" and "dollar".  Ex: US$, CA$, MEX$.

Most usages on Danbooru will likely be for US dollars.

h4. See also

* [[Dollar bill]]
* [[Money]]
* [[Yen sign]]
* [[Tag group:Symbols]]
* [[Tag group:Text]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dollar sign":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign]

title: handbell
body:
A hollow [[bell]] designed to be rung by hand, seen most often with [[singing|carolers]] around [[Christmas]] time.

h4. See also

* [[instrument]]
* [[jingle bell]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: jingle_bell
body:
A spherical metal ball containing an unattached clapper with only a small slit opening, for higher pitched ringing. This [[bell]] is largely associated with holidays like [[Christmas]] or seen on the [[neck bell|collars]] of domestic [[pet|pets]].

h4. See also

* [[hair bell]]
* [[tail bell]]
* [[Kagura suzu]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: ryona_no_kane
body: A subset of [[ryona]] that takes inspiration from [[joya no kane]]. Instead of a [[bell]], the impact of the [[log]] is focused on a person (usually their [[stomach]]).

title: icing_spatula
body:
A icing/frosting spatula (also known as a palette knife) is a kitchen tool with a long straight blunt metal blade designed especially for the use of spreading and smoothing things such as [[icing|frosting]] on cakes.

h4. Example

* !post #8589168

h4. See also

* [[Palette knife]] (the tool used for [[painting_(action)|]])
* [[Spatula]]

title: rye_project
body: A retired [[Indie Virtual Youtuber]].

title: help:cheatsheet
ultraman_belial_early_style
body:
The Early Style of [[Ultraman Belial]], first introduced in [[Dai-Kaijuu Battle Ultra Ginga Densetsu The Movie]].

Initially relegated to flashback appearances only (as well as seen in [[Ultraman Geed]]'s transformation sequence), in [[Ultra Galaxy Fight: The Absolute Conspiracy]], the appearance of [[Absolute Tartarus]] in the past would result in the creation of a Parallel Isotope clone of Belial. This clone lacks the mutated elements of his regular appearance induced by his merger with Reiblood Seijin, including the absence of his black skin.
other_names: ベリアルアーリースタイル

title: crescent_hat_ornament
body:

title: crescent_hair_ornament
body:
A [[hair ornament]] or [[hairpin]] shaped like a [[crescent]].

[[Patchouli Knowledge]] of [[Touhou]] is frequently shown to wear one in her hair when she is not wearing her [[mob cap]]. It is also a signature element of the character [[Rena Lanford]] from the [[Star Ocean]] series.

title: on_crescent
body:
[[Standing]], [[sitting]], [[lying]], [[kneeling]], [[squatting]], or similar on a [[crescent]] shape item or a fantasy [[crescent moon]].

h4. See also

* [[on moon]]

title: industrial_pipe
body:
A tube of metal, plastic, or other material used to convey water, gas, oil, or other fluid substances.

For the item used for [[smoking]], see [[smoking pipe]].

For pipes made of lead, which are commonly used as weapons, see [[lead pipe]].

title: rodney_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the HMS Rodney and one of the Big 7 along with her sister [[Nelson (azur lane)|]].

She has [[blue eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] tied in a [[half up braid]]. She wears a [[microdress]] military uniform with a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] and [[white thighhighs]], [[detached sleeves]] showing her [[bare shoulders|shoulders]], and [[aiguillette]] and a [[brooch]] on her [[detached collar]].

Character design by [[Kaede (Yumesaki Kaede)]], voiced by [[Taichi You]].

title: ots-14_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[OTs-14 Groza]] [[assault rifle]] in [[Girls' Frontline]]. Originally designed and illustrated by [[ask (askzy)]] in the original game, with other artists taking the mantle later on, including for her cover appearance in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]] (now calling herself just [[Groza (girls' frontline 2)|]]). Voiced by [[Inoue Marina]].

OTs-14 has [[yellow eyes]], [[blonde hair|blonde]] or [[light brown hair|light brown]] [[long hair]] tied into [[nape braid]] and [[low ponytail]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]], [[red choker]], [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[black coat]], [[black neckerchief]], [[brown corset]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], ([[two-tone thighhighs|two-tone]]) [[red thighhighs|red]] [[vertical-striped thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[knee boots|knee-length]] [[high heel boots]].

h4. Appearance 

* !post #3635708

title: ltlx_7000_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Beretta LTLX 7000]] [[shotgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[aqua hair]], [[red eyes]], [[ear piercing]] and wears a [[white bodysuit]].

Contrary to her aloof appearance, she is all warm and fuzzy on the inside. She always stops herself, almost out of reflex, from blurting out whatever she is about to say, which makes her rather intimidating to people she is talking to. She loves all things that are soft. If she sees a sofa, she has to sprawl on it. She's afraid of scissors and fears getting cut.

Voiced by [[Tanaka Rie]] and illustrated by [[Afukuro]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4190562

title: the_iron_crown_(darkest_dungeon)
body:
A recurring symbol in [[Darkest Dungeon]] and [[Darkest Dungeon II|its sequel]], often associated with the [[affliction (darkest dungeon)|]] mechanic. The Iron Crown - a semicircle intersected by five lines - appeared somewhere in the mythos of every ancient culture known to history, regardless of geography.

[spoiler]In Darkest Dungeon II, it is revealed to be the entity responsible for the corruption of the world.[/spoiler]

title: visual_novel
body:
A style of game that mainly consists of text (both dialogues and narrative) over a background image. Many games have the player make [[choice]]s that affect the outcome of the story.

This tag is for both real and [[fake screenshot]]s of visual novels.

For images featuring only the background image with no [[dialogue box]], use [[game cg]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Gameplay mechanics]]
* [[Choice]]
* [[Dialogue box]]
* [[Dialogue options]]
* [[Tag group:Visual novel games]]

h4. External links

* "VNDB: the visual novel database":http://vndb.org/d6
* "Wikipedia: Visual novel":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_Novel
* "Wikipedia: Dating sim":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dating_sim]

title: speech_bubble
body:
A bubble with a pointed end that shows what a character is [[talking|saying]]. It can either have text or an object. If it is empty add the tag [[blank speech bubble]].

For a bubble containing thoughts or dreaming use [[thought bubble]].

h4. See also
* [[Dialogue box]]
* [[Blank speech bubble]]
* [[Image in speech bubble]]
* [[Image in thought bubble]]
* [[Speech stab]]
* [[Shared speech bubble]]
* [[Spoken object]]

title: dialogue_box
body:
A pop-up message on a screen, usually at the bottom. This is typically used in a visual novel or RPG games either to narrate the story or to represent character's dialogue.

Not to be confused with [[speech bubble]], which refers to a dialogue box stylized from comic and manga.

h4. See also

* [[dialogue options]]
* [[user interface]]
* [[error message]]
* [[visual novel]]
* [[gameplay mechanics]]
* [[speech bubble]]

title: scar
body:
A mark left on the skin where a [[deep wound|wound]], [[cuts|cut]], burn, or other [[injury]] healed.

For the character from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]], see [[Scar (FMA)]].

Also not to be confused with the [[FN SCAR]] rifle, or either of the [i][[Girls' Frontline]][/i] [[scar-l (girls' frontline)|characters]] [[scar-h (girls' frontline)|based on it.]]

It's a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[collared shirt]] or [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[plaid bowtie|plaid]] [[blue bowtie|dark blue bowtie]], either a [[blue jacket|dark blue]] [[blazer]] a [[brown cardigan]] with [[sleeves past wrists]] or a [[white jacket]] with a [[bear hood]], a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[blue skirt|dark blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[blue socks|dark blue socks]] and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[very long hair]] [[colored inner hair]] with a gradient from [[green hair|green]]/[[aqua hair|aqua]] to [[pink hair|pink]] with [[sidelocks]] and a [[side braid]] held with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]], a large [[butterfly hair ornament]] and a smaller butterfly-shaped [[hairclip]] or [[short hair]] in a [[bob cut]] and a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]].

title: lawine_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
Third-class mage who participated in the First Class Mage Examinations, where she was paired with [[Kanne (sousou_no_frieren)|]] and [[Frieren]] for the first exam. She specializes in manipulating ice.

Lawine is a young female mage with [[grey hair]] or [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She has [[blunt bangs]] and her [[long hair|hair is waist length]] is [[low-tied long hair|tied low]] with a [[half up braid]]. Lawine wears a [[blue dress]] that goes to mid thigh and is lined with ruffles at the hem. The front of her dress is cut into a deep, laced v-neck layered over a [[white blouse]]. On top of the dress, Lawine wears a matching [[frilled capelet|frilled]] [[blue capelet]] similarly lined with [[frilled collar|ruffles at the hem]]. On her feet, she wears thigh high white laced boots with heels.
other_names: ラヴィーネ(葬送のフリーレン)

title: l_hand
body:
A hand that forms an L shape, typically with two or [[w|three fingers]]. 

Seen in instances such as the [[loser gesture]], [[finger gun]]s and characters that are [[pointing]] or [[blowing kiss|blowing a kiss]].


Other cultural meanings:
* With two fingers: The number seven (South China) or eight (North China)
* With three fingers: The number seven (North China) or eight (South China)
* The number two (Various European countries)

h4. See also

* [[Double L]]
* [[Inward L]]
* [[V]]

title: messmer_the_impaler
body:
[[Elden Ring]] character. A son of [[Queen Marika The Eternal|Queen Marika]], charged with leading the crusade against the Hornsent.
He is a tall and gangly man with [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] and multiple [[snake|abyssal serpents]] protruding from his body. Both of his eyes are [[hollow eyes|missing]]; to hide this, he has a [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[artificial eye|prosthetic]] in his right eye, and simply keeps his left eye closed. He wears [[ornate armor|ornate]] yet light armor with a [[red cloak]] and [[red skirt|skirt]], and wields a [[lance]] in combat.

title: quidditch
body:
A fictional sport from the [[Harry Potter (Series)|Harry Potter]] franchise, played in teams of seven players riding flying broomsticks. [[Harry Potter]] became the Seeker for the [[Gryffindor]] Quidditch team in his first year at [[Hogwarts]].


Quidditch inspired the development of the real life team sport quadball.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Quidditch":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quidditch]

title: killdozer
body:
The "Killdozer" incident occurred on June 4, 2004, in Granby, Colorado, when Marvin Heemeyer, frustrated by local government decisions affecting his business, armored a bulldozer and went on a destructive rampage. Heemeyer's modified bulldozer, later nicknamed "Killdozer," demolished 13 buildings, including the town hall and a former mayor's house, causing over $5 million in damages.

The rampage lasted about 90 minutes, and while no one else was harmed, Heemeyer took his own life when the bulldozer got stuck. This incident has since become a controversial and somewhat legendary story, with some viewing Heemeyer as a folk hero standing up against perceived injustices.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Marvin Heemeyer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvin_Heemeyer]

title: cinderella_(fairy_tale_character)
body:
The main heroine of [[Cinderella (fairy tale)|]], a folk tale where she has to work as a scullery maid for her wicked stepmother and two stepsisters. One night, her life changes when her fairy godmother uses magic to transform her clothes into a beautiful ball gown so she can attend a ball being held to select a bride for the kingdom's prince. The stipulation is that the magic will wear out at midnight. Cinderella meets the prince and he is enamored by her beauty, but she must suddenly leave at midnight. She accidentally leaves a [[glass slipper]] for the prince to use as a means of finding her again. When the slipper fits Cinderella's foot, she and the prince are married happily ever after.

h4. See also

* [[Cinderella (Disney character)]]

title: tohno_shiki
body:
Tohno Shiki is a character and protagonist of the Japanese visual novel and anime series [[Tsukihime]], its sequel [[Kagetsu Tooya]] and its spinoff [[Melty Blood]], created by [[Type-Moon]]. He is voiced by [[Suzumura Ken'ichi]] in the anime series, while in Melty Blood is voiced by [[Nojima Kenji]].

A young man with an athletic build, unruly [[black hair]] that partially covers his forehead, with some locks falling just over the rim of his [[glasses]], which have a simple, rectangular frame. He is dressed in a traditional Japanese [[school uniform]].

He possesses the [[Mystic Eyes of Death Perception]], Mystic Eyes that allow him to see "death." 

[spoiler]Tohno and [[Nanaya Shiki]] are often tagged together if the Shiki in the image is sufficiently badass. The jury's still out on [[Satsujinki]]...[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24287342: Original
* !post #8200527: Remake

h4. See also

* [[Nanatsu-Yoru]] - Shiki's Knife
* [[Nanaya Shiki]]
* [[Satsujinki]]
* [[Ryougi Shiki]] - Predecessor from [[Kara no Kyoukai]]. Has a similar name, similar powers, and also wields a knife. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Shiki Tohno":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiki_Tohno

title: ingrid_brandl_galatea
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] from the Kingdom of Faerghus. Ingrid is a member of the Blue Lions, and aspires to become a knight.

She has [[blonde hair]], [[green eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. She bears a Minor [[Crest of Daphnel]].

In-game, Ingrid has high speed and above-average magic resistance, making her ideal as a Pegasus Knight, but she has mediocre strength and low physical durability. She is one of the few characters in the game to have no skill weaknesses, letting her promote into just about any class with enough effort.

title: felix_hugo_fraldarius
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]].

Felix is a blunt, sharp-tongued swordsman who spends the majority of his time training, pursuing ever greater strength. His older brother, [[Glenn Fraldarius|Glenn]], was betrothed to [[Ingrid Brandl Galatea]], but perished during the Tragedy of Duscur. Where [[Rodrigue Achille Fraldarius|his father]] and Ingrid began to glorify Glenn's passing in a chivalric light, Felix grew disgusted with that behavior and distanced himself from those very ideals.

Felix often refers to [[Dimitri Alexandre Blaiddyd]] as the "boar prince" due to the latter's bloodlust, having witnessed Dimitri battling in a frenzied state two years prior to the start of the game's events.

In-game, Felix has very high Speed and Strength, making him an ideal Swordmaster, Grappler or War Master, but his durability is unimpressive. Furthermore, Felix bears a Major Crest of Fraldarius, which gives him some of the highest damage output in the game due to its powerful effect and solid activation rate.

In [[Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes|Three Hopes]], Rodrigue took full responsibility for Prince Rufus's chaotic regency and abdicated from his position, leaving Felix to become Duke Fraldarius in the wake of his father's abdication.

Voiced by "Lucien Dodge":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucien_Dodge] (English), "Jose Yuuichi":[https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/people.php?id=142068] (Japanese).

h4. Appearance

title: ajaw_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC in [[Genshin Impact]]. His full name is K'uhul Ajaw.

A hovering, green and yellow, [[pixelated]], 2D dragon that is typically accompanying [[Kinich_(genshin_impact)|]]. He often wears [[sunglasses]], and has a striped tail that alternates yellow and dark green colors.

[spoilers]Ajaw was one of the thirteen dragonlords of ancient Natlan, but was imprisoned in a phlogiston bracelet when humanity revolted against the dragons. Kinich would later discover him and enter a contract with Ajaw, giving him access to Ajaw's powers in exchange for letting the dragonlord have his body once he dies.[/spoilers]

title: mini_durin_(human)_(genshin_impact)
body:
The human form of [[Mini Durin (Genshin Impact)|]][spoiler], transformed from his [[Mini Durin (Dragon) (Genshin Impact)|dragon form]] by [[Albedo (Genshin Impact)|]][/spoiler].

In this form he takes the appearance of a [[dragon boy]], with [[short hair with long locks|short]] [[purple hair]] and [[hair between eyes]], as well as [[dragon wings]] and [[dragon horns]].

title: mini_durin_(genshin_impact)
body:
An NPC from [[Genshin Impact]]. Voiced by [[Kobayashi Chiaki]] in Japanese. 

His identity is an alternate version of [[Durin (real) (genshin impact)|]] found in Simulanka, created by "M" of the Hexenzirkel. His completed human design was revealed in "Song of the Welkin Moon Teaser: Moonlit Ballad of the Night":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWDyxSo-oq0.

title: affliction_(darkest_dungeon)
body:
A commonly seen game mechanic in [[Darkest Dungeon]] and [[Darkest Dungeon II|its sequel]], it appears over the heads of affected individuals who have succumbed to a severe negative emotion or madness. The affliction can be obtained from many of the game's stress-related mechanics and inflicts a negative effect on the afflicted individual.

It is often seen with its iconic black circular arc and five spike like protrusions, heading inwards, surrounded by a red hue floating above characters' heads to indicate they are currently plagued by said affliction. 

[spoilers]Through the many challenges that the heroes of Darkest Dungeon 2 go through, it is eventually revealed that its true name is: '[[The Iron Crown (darkest dungeon)|]]' and is actually the entity responsible for causing many of Darkest Dungeon's abomination related disasters and spreading the corruption in the land.[/spoilers]

title: hirasawa_susumu
body:
A Japanese electronic musician usually known for composing music for [[Berserk]], [[Paprika]], [[sennen joyuu|Millennium Actress]], and [[mousou dairinin|Paranoia Agent]]. He started the band known as [[P-MODEL]] in 1979.

[[K-On!]] makes references to P-MODEL through the five main characters' surnames. Many K-On! fan works make reference to this, with examples of fan works making references to Hirasawa Susumu using [[Hirasawa Yui]] found in posts such as post #481261 and post #480735.

He "once":http://twitter.com/hirasawa/status/5170026790 made mention of Yui on his Twitter:

[quote]
[i]間違えてないか？私は平沢進だぞ。平沢唯じゃない。
Are you mistaken? I am Hirasawa Susumu, NOT Hirasawa Yui.[/i]
[/quote]

h4. Discography

* [[Error (hirasawa susumu)|]]
* [[Saiensu no Yuurei (album)|]]
* [[Siren (hirasawa susumu)|]]
* [[Kyuusai no Gihou]]
* [[Hologram o Noboru Otoko]]

h4. See also

* [[Byakkoya no Musume]]

title: egeria_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known as the Lord of Amrita or the Mistress of Many Waters, she was the original Hydro Archon and the predecessor of the latest Hydro Archon, [spoiler][[Focalors (genshin impact)|]][/spoiler].

Egeria was created by [[Naberius (genshin impact)|]] as the new "heart" for the Primordial Sea after the Hydro Dragon was removed. She assumed control of Fontaine after the fall of Remuria and the death of it's God King, Remus and established Fontaine's laws. She allegedly created the [[Oceanid (genshin impact)|]]s [spoiler](including Focalors)[/spoiler] after she shed the "first tear". Egeria died around 500 years ago during the Cataclysm and her body turned into the water of the Amrita.

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Egeria":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Egeria

title: viet_cong
body:
Known in the Western world by the name "Viet Cong" (meaning "Red Vietnamese"), the [b]National Liberation Front[/b] was a [[communism|communist]] revolutionary organization that operated in South Vietnam and Cambodia after the post-colonial division of Vietnam in December 1960. During the [[Vietnam War]], the NLF was a [[guerilla]] movement that fought primarily in the southern provinces of South Vietnam against the forces of the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] and their international allies.

Although the NLF was officially disbanded in 1977 after Vietnam was successfully reunified, the organization had functionally ceased to exist after suffering catastrophic losses during the failed 1968 [[Tet Offensive]]. Although North Vietnam would continue to pay lip service to their southern comrades during the remainder of the conflict (even flying [[Viet Cong flag]]s from their tanks as they entered Saigon), practically speaking the remainder of the conflict would be a conventional war, waged by the [[People's Army of Vietnam]] with what remained of the NLF providing logistical support. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viet_Cong]
other_names: 南ベトナム解放民族戦線

title: kishimoto_kei
body:
Character from [[Gantz]].
Her death involved slitting her wrists while in a bathtub; so she arrives in the Tokyo condominium nude. Yet unlike many of the characters of the series, she did not exactly die, she was revived at the hospital - after her family found her. Which means the Kishimoto in the games - is a copy. This is due to a mistake by Gantz.

She [copy Kishimoto] later dies in a mission (dubbed Buddha mission), trying to protect Kato Masaru; whom she had fallen in love with.

The detailed status of the real Kishimoto is unknown, but she was last seen living her life.

"Wikipedia Gantz":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Gantz_characters#Kei_Kishimoto

title: jason_(fate)
body:
Character appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He first appeared as an NPC during the [[Okeanos (fate/grand order)|]] before being released as a Saber-class Servant during the 5th anniversary. A Greek mythological hero who was the leader of the [[Argonauts (fate)|]], and was married to [[Medea (fate)|]].

It should be noted that Fate's version of Jason is particularly abusive and cowardly, especially towards Medea, though he considers [[Heracles (fate)|]] as his best friend. In combat, he directs [[Medea lily (fate)|]], [[Atalanta (fate)|]], and [[Heracles (fate)|]] to attack for him on his behalf.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BLACK (artist)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hoshi Souichirou]]

title: nero_claudius_(fate/extra)
body:
Saber-class Servant originally from [[Fate/Extra]], who also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. See [[Nero Claudius (Fate)]] for other versions of Nero.

Her normal outfit is a military-style [[red dress]] with [[epaulettes]] and a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] part that shows a white [[leotard]] underneath. Sometimes depicted with her [[sword]], [[Aestus Estus]]. Her Noble Phantasm is  [[Aestus Domus Aurea]], a giant [[colosseum]].

Despite their very similar appearances, Nero Claudius and [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]] are different characters.

Designed by [[Wada Arco]] and [[Takeuchi Takashi]], and voiced by [[Tange Sakura]].

title: elizabeth_bathory_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant from the [[Fate (series)|Fate]] series. The (younger) depiction of the Hungarian "blood countess" of the same name.

Appears as a small girl with [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She has [[uneven horns]], a [[dragon_tail|tail]], [[pointy ears]], and pink nails that take up the entirety of her actual fingers. She wears a dress and high heel boots with a single spike protruding from each one which all have a diamond theme.

In [[rojiura satsuki: chapter heroine sanctuary|Rojiura Sanctuary]], she wears an [[idol]] costume with a black [[corset]] and a [[plaid skirt|plaid white-and-black skirt]] (treated as her Second Ascension outfit in [[Fate/Grand Order]]).

[b]True Name:[/b] Elizabeth Báthory
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Wada Arco]]

body:
Red and/or white lights on top of [[skyscraper|skycrapers]] and tall phone towers. Generally blinking but doesn't always have to be. 

Helps low flying pilots navigating in and around cities

title: mysterious_idol_x_alter_(fate)
body:
A version of [[Mysterious Heroine X Alter (fate)|]] transformed by [[Miss Crane (fate)|]] into a Foreigner-class Servant during the [[Kagayake! Grail Live!!]] event. Uses her guitar and various references to rhythm games to fight. Her Noble Phantasm is Luminous Calibur.

Her laid-back nature, guitar and idol outfit resemble [[Aoba Moca]] from [[BanG Dream!]], oddly enough.

title: napoleon_bonaparte_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the Lostbelt arc. The depiction of the [[napoleon bonaparte|famous military leader]] of the same name.

Napoleon's appearance is different from his self in history. His third ascension outfit seems to be based on the romantic oil painting [[napoleon_crossing_the_alps|Napoléon Crossing the Alps]] done by Jacques-Louis David in 1801. It is stated that if he was summoned as a Rider, his height would decrease.

A tall, muscular man with [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]], and facial hair in the style of [[goatee]] and [[long sideburns]]. Usually depicted in [[bara]] style with an [[open jacket|open]] [[leather jacket]] and [[epaulettes]] (with [[fringe trim]] and [[long sleeves]]) on top of an [[open shirt]] that shows off his [[pectorals]] and [[cross scar|cross scarred]] [[scar on chest| chest]]. When his jacket is not [[partially unbuttoned]] he usually wears his [[military uniform]] with a [[shoulder sash]], [[medal]], [[ascot]], [[belt]], [[tight clothes]] [[white pants]], and [[leather boots|leather]] [[knee boots]]).

He wields a [[huge weapon|huge]] [[cannon]] that shoots [[rainbow]]. According to in-game lines, the cannon was designed by [[Charles Babbage (fate)|]], despite the UK and France considered each other enemies during their lifetime.

A legend says that during his campaign in [[Egypt]], he spent a night inside the [[great pyramid of giza|Great Pyramid]] and had a vision of his most admired hero, Alexander the Great ([[Iskandar (fate)|]]). This fact is included in one of Napoleon's in-game lines and has inspired fans to depict them as a [[bara]] [[couple]], especially since both were known as charismatic military leader and historical connections.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ryota-H]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hino Satoshi]]

title: lord_el-melloi_ii
body:
[[Aged up|Older version]] of [[Waver Velvet]].

[spoiler]He is only a steward of the title, having been given it by [[Reines El-Melloi Archisorte]], the proper heir of the house of El-Melloi. This was both in recognition of his accomplishments, as well as in exchange for assisting the El-Melloi after the destabilizing impact made by the death of [[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald|Kayneth Archibald]].[/spoiler]

Can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]] under the Caster designation, but as the host body of [[Zhuge Liang]] (similar to how [[Tohsaka Rin]] is the host of Ishtar).

[spoiler]He is responsible for dismantling the Holy Grail after the fifth Holy Grail War. He is also the only surviving master of the 4th Grail War, following the deaths of [[Emiya Kiritsugu]] and [[Kotomine Kirei]].[/spoiler]

[[Tohsaka Rin]]'s lecturer at the Magus Association and possesses an interest in the popular culture of Japan (though he likes little else about the country).

Featured as the eponymous protagonist of [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]] novel series written by Sanda Makoto and illustrated by [[Sakamoto Mineji]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Namikawa Daisuke]]

title: reines_el-melloi_archisorte
body:
The biological niece and adopted sister of [[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald]], belonging to the Archisorte branch of the family. [spoiler]After his death, she is selected as heir-apparent of the house of El-Melloi. She appoints [[Waver Velvet]] as her step-brother and steward to the title as [[Lord El-Melloi II]] until she is of proper age to assume it herself.[/spoiler] When using her [[Mystic Eyes]], her [[aqua eyes]] turn [[red eyes|red]].

A [[aged down]], [[short hair|short-haired]] version of her appears in episode 1 of the [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]] anime and the special episode.

She first appeared in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] before being featured as a main character in [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]]. She can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as a Rider-class Pseudo-Servant, with [[Sima Yi]] of [i]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/i] inhabiting her body.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]], [[Sakamoto Mineji]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Minase Inori]]

title: ptolemy_(fate)
body:
A minor character introduced in [[Fate/Zero]]. A soldier of [[Iskandar (fate)|]]'s army, who is seen as part of [[Ionioi Hetairoi (fate)|]]. He would later go on to become an Egyptian pharaoh, being the founder of the Ptolemaic dynasty that would last until the death of his descendant [[Cleopatra (fate)|]]. He can be summoned as an individual Archer-class servant in either of the two primes of his life, as either a young soldier in Iskandar's army or as the older ruler of Egypt. He is summoned in his older form in [[The Adventures of Lord El-Melloi II]] by [[Sion Eltnam Sokaris]] and [[Ergo (fate)|]]. He was introduced into [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[Shiroten no Shiro Kuroban no Shiro|Shiroten no Shiro, Kuroban no Shiro]] event, with his first two ascensions having his younger appearance and his third ascension having his older appearance. [b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]] [b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Ono Kensho]] (young), [[Horiuchi Ken'yu]] (old) h4. title: iskandar_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Zero]] character. The Rider-class servant of [[Waver Velvet]]. He also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. His true name is Iskandar, aka [[Alexander the Great]].

A hulking, [[muscular male|muscular]] [[beard|bearded]] man with [[red hair]], [[red eyes]], wearing [[leather]] armor, including a [[breastplate]] with a [[front slit]] and a [[fur-trimmed_cape|fur-trimmed]] [[red cape]]. When wearing casual clothes, he's usually shown with a short sleeved [[T-shirt]] and [[jeans]].

He has been paired by fans with [[Napoleon Bonaparte (fate)|]] from the same game, due to the Napoleon's admiration of him as well as their real life historical connections. They have been drawn together by Napoleon's official designer [[Ryota-H]] [s](post #3531202)[/s].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Ootsuka Akio]]

title: tamamo_no_mae_(swimsuit_lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[tamamo no mae (fate)| Tamamo no Mae]] from [[Fate/Grand Order]] for the [[Chaldea Summer Memory|2016 Summer Event]]. She wears a [[blue bikini]] [[bikini under clothes|underneath]] a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]], a [[straw hat]], an [[innertube]] for her tail, and a [[towel]] that bears her name. Her weapon is a [[parasol]] thereby classifying her as a Lancer.

The bikini and wet t-shirt combination that she wears in her Second Ascension was later released as a DLC costume in [[Fate/Extella Link]], given the name [b]Beach Flower[/b].

Do not add the [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate)]] tag if Tamamo Lancer is by herself. They are treated as separated characters and should only be tagged together if they both appear in an image, or one is [[cosplay]]ing as the other.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

title: sieg_(fate)
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Fate/Apocrypha]] alongside [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]]. He is a nameless homunculus created by [[Gordes Musik Yggdmillennia]] who becomes the secondary master of the [[Astolfo (fate)|Rider of "Black"]] after gaining a consciousness and escaping from the Black faction. He would later be given the heart of [[Siegfried (fate)|]] in order to save his life, allowing him to temporarily shapeshift into him in combat and giving him his moniker.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hanae Natsuki]]

title: sessyoin_kiara
body:
Wizard and master of [[Hans Christian Andersen (fate)|Caster]] in [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]].[spoiler] She leads a virtual Buddhist cult whose beliefs involve around rising to a higher plane of existence via sexual activity. She's the true antagonist and final boss of the game. [/spoiler]

Another version of her is the therapist of a branch of Chaldea in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s chapter [i]Abyssal Cyber Paradise, SE.RA.PH[/i]. [spoiler] She's later taken over by the [[demon pillar (fate)|Demon God Zepar]], taking on the personality of her CCC self, and ultimately transforms into a Beast-class Servant.[/spoiler] Her playable version is under the Alter Ego designation. While her nun and demon designs are present in both CCC and FGO, her design with arms printed on a longer dress and horns adorned with rings and tassels is exclusive to FGO.

An [[sessyoin_kiara_(swimsuit_mooncancer)|alternate Moon Cancer-class Servant]] and her [[sessyoin_kiara_(lily)|aged down]] version were introduced in FGO's Summer 2020 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tanaka Rie]]

title: gorgon_(fate)
body:
The fully monstrous Avenger-class form of [[Medusa (fate)|]], first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity.

Like Medusa, she has [[purple hair]], [[very long hair]], a [[blindfold]], with [[huge breasts|much bigger breasts]]. In addition, she gains [[monster girl|monstrous qualities]] such as [[claws]], [[scales]], [[snake hair]], [[square pupils|square]] or [[slit pupils]], and, in her final form, [[wings]]. Her outfit consists of a black or white [[bustier]], with a [[cleavage cutout]] and a long skirt with a [[pelvic curtain]], leaving the midriff and [[navel]] exposed.

Her Noble Phantasm, [[Pandemonium Cetus]], fully transforms her into a [[monster]] form that first appeared in flashbacks of [[Fate/hollow ataraxia]].

title: kiyohime_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], based on the Japanese folktale of the same name. Appears as a young woman with long green hair, wearing a kimono and holding a fan. Sometimes portrayed as either a [[dragon girl]] or a [[lamia]].

A [[Yandere]] that can turn into a large serpent or a dragon. Does not like being lied to and believes the master is the reincarnation of her beloved. Her legend has it she trapped him inside a bell and burned him to death after he broke his promise and betrayed her.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[BLACK (artist)|]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Taneda Risa]]

title: william_tell_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt.

A Swiss folk hero who rebelled against the tyrannical Albrecht Gessler, ultimately assassinating him and inspiring others to rise up against Austrian rule. There is an infamous [[William Tell (legend)|anecdote]] of Tell shooting an apple off his son's head in one shot.

title: lakshmibai_(fate)
body:
Saber-class servant debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. An [[Indian]] queen and warrior. She was one of the greatest leaders of the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and became a symbol of resistance to British rule in India.

In-game, her overall appearance is similar to [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] (a nod to her nickname [i]Jeanne d'Arc of India[/i]), but with [[white hair]], [[dark skin]], and two long [[braid]]s. Thus, she also has the [i]Saberface[/i] trait. She dual-wields an Indian sword and a [[caplock]] firearm.

Due to the unique circumstances of the Indian Lostbelt, she also hosts a divided spirit of "Lakshmi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lakshmi, in part due to their shared [[name connection]]. [spoiler]She actually specifically hosts "Alakshmi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alakshmi, the older sister of Lakshmi and a goddess of misfortune.[/spoiler] The divided spirit has very little influence on her personality, so she's mostly the same as she was in life.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Satou Rina]]

title: durga_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. One of the two major avatars of the [[Hindu mythology|Hindu]] mother goddess [[Parvati (fate)|]], alongside [[Kali (fate)|]] (who she transforms into in her third ascension). This form represents Parvati as the "warrior goddess" and the protector of the universe. As with her base form, she uses [[Matou Sakura]] as her vessel.

title: arthur_pendragon_(fate)
body:
Originally called Archetype Saber, he is the version of [[Saber (fate)|]] that was to be used in the original [[Fate/stay night]] novel that was penned and left uncompleted. He would later make an official debut in [[Fate/Prototype]] as a Saber from an entirely different time tree, complete with his own characterization and contextual differences compared to the Saber from Fate/stay night.

Arthur's parameters differ from Artoria's as well; he sacrifices Mana and Luck for greater Strength and Endurance. This is similarly reflected in their fighting styles; whereas Artoria fights very elegantly and supplements her swordplay with her Servant Skills, Arthur fights very functionally, almost coldly, and funnels his skills into his martial prowess.

Arthur plays a prominent background role in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as well: [spoiler]he is chasing Beast VI across time and space, with the intent to slay it for good after unsuccessfully attempting such in 1991 and 1999 of his own time tree.[/spoiler]

A [[blonde hair]]ed man with [[green eyes]], his [[armor]] set includes a [[breastplate]], [[pauldrons]], [[gauntlets]], [[faulds]], [[greaves]] and a [[hood]]; slight differences in design compared to Saber. His weapon is another version of [[Excalibur (Fate/Prototype)|Excalibur]]. His casual outfit consists of a red [[t-shirt]] with [[black pants]] and a long [[black jacket]]. He is often seen with [[Sajou Ayaka (Fate/Prototype)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Nakahara (mu tation)|Nakahara]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Sakurai Takahiro]]

title: amakusa_shirou_(fate)
body:
A character from the [[Fate/Apocrypha]] series. Master of [[Semiramis (fate)|]], sent by the Holy Church. He initially goes by the alias of [b]Shirou Kotomine[/b] (an homage to [[Kotomine Kirei]] and [[Emiya Shirou]]) before revealing his true nature as a Servant with the true name of "Amakusa Shirou":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amakusa_Shir%C5%8D], the leader of the Shimabara Rebellion. He appears as a Ruler-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: meltryllis_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. Also known as [b]Meltlilith[/b]. She appears in [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC Fox Tail]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She resembles [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. She wears a large black cloak, with [[long sleeves]] that [[sleeves past fingers|cover her hands]], and a metal [[crotch plate]]. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], her crotch plate becomes a chain metal [[thong]]. Her most distinctive features are her metallic legs, which have long spikes that protrude from her knees and feet.

In [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], she is the aspect of BB representing pleasure, and she uses ballet techniques in her fighting style. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she appears as an Alter Ego-class Servant.

Her floral namesakes are the [[Amaryllis (flower)|]] and the [[Lily (flower)|]]. Her component spirits are [[Artemis (fate)|]], [[Leviathan (mythology)|]], and [[Saraswati]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hayami Saori]]

title: galatea_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Akihabara Explosion!]] event. The statue carved of ivory by Pygmalion of Cyprus. He fell in love with his creation and prayed for it to come to life. [[Aphrodite (fate)|]] responded and animated the statue, then united them in marriage. [spoiler]In actuality, Aphrodite was only able to create life by putting a fragment of herself into the statue, resulting in Galatea having some goddess-level abilities and attributes.[/spoiler]

title: charles_babbage_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[London (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. A mathematician from 18th century who build the foundation of computer engineering, which leads him to being honored as [b]"Father of the Computers"[/b].

In game, he appears as a bulky, steam-powered [[mecha]] due to surrounding himself [spoiler](his soul)[/spoiler] in a Reality Marble representing his dream of a [[steampunk]] world. [spoiler]Essentially making him a living steam-powered robot.[/spoiler]

title: bb_(fate/extra)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate]] character. [[BB (fate)|]] as she appears in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] and as a 4-star MoonCancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Appearance-wise, she looks like [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her normal outfit is a Dracula-like [[black coat]] with a high collar, a [[white shirt]] with a large [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist skirt]] (that emphasizes her [[large breasts]]), and [[thigh boots]].

Not to be confused with [[BB (Swimsuit Mooncancer) (Third Ascension) (fate)|]]. Both wear a similar black cape, but [[BB (Fate/Extra)]] wears a sleeved shirt with a [[high-waist skirt]], while [[BB (Swimsuit Mooncancer) (fate)|]] wears a white halterneck leotard.

[b]This tag is for her costume introduced in [[Fate/Extra CCC]]. If she's wearing a different costume, do not use this tag.[/b]

body:

In the [[Saber Wars II]] event, she kidnapped the player character and brought them to the [[Servant Universe (fate)|]] where she resides, hoping to use them in her plan to take over the galaxy. She is one of the fragments of the primordial goddess [[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|Astarte Origin]] who was raised by [[Yagyuu Munenori (fate)|Munenori]] to become the leader of the Space Shinkageryuu. [spoiler]While initially assumed to be goddess' evil half, it is revealed she is actually the good half.[/spoiler]

title: space_ishtar_(fate)
body:
Avenger-Class variant of [[Ishtar (fate)|]] from the [[Servant Universe (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing in [[Battle in New York 2019]] before being featured in the [[Saber Wars II]] event. Like Ishtar, she uses [[Tohsaka Rin]]'s body as a container, but a slightly younger version than the one Ishtar uses.

Each ascension is presented as a different individual, with [b]Astarte[/b] as her [[Space Ishtar (First Ascension) (fate)|first ascension]], [b]Space Ishtar[/b] as her [[Space Ishtar (Second Ascension) (fate)|second ascension]] (nicknamed Ishtarin), and [b]Ishtar Astarte[/b] as her [[Space Ishtar (Third Ascension) (fate)|third ascension]]. All three can be distinguished by their eye colors and their personalities.

Astarte and Ishtarin were originally fragments of the primordial goddess [[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|Astarte Origin]], being split into good and evil halves. Ishtarin was raised by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi|Professor Tokiomi]] and started work as a bounty hunter alongside [[Calamity Jane (fate)|]] after his death, while Astarte was raised by [[Yagyuu Munenori (fate)|Munenori]] to be the emotionless leader of the Space Shinkageryuu. [spoiler]While Ishtarin was initially assumed to be the good half and Astarte the evil half, it's revealed in one of Tokiomi's recordings that the opposite is true. This revelation is what allows them to synchronize into Ishtar Astarte.[/spoiler]

[[Bel Maana (fate)|]] is summoned when using their [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] [b]Edin Shugurra Quasar[/b], manifesting the massive goddess shrine the size of a galaxy (or rather, a galaxy that takes the form of a goddess).

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ueda Kana]]

body:
[[abigail williams (swimsuit foreigner) (fate)|Abigail Williams Swimsuit Foreigner]] in her First Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Unlike her regular [[abigail williams (fate)|Foreigner]] variant, her Swimsuit Foreigner does her character designs backwards, introducing the grey-skinned and white-haired version as the First Ascension here. She has her hair in elaborate double buns with black and orange bows, the keyhole with a red eye is present on her forehead, and she wears a small black bikini and black gloves.

Do not confuse this Ascension with her regular Foreigner variant's [[abigail williams (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]], nor her [[abigail williams (tour outfit) (fate)|Heroic Spirit Tour Outfit]].

title: mysterious_heroine_xx_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class version of [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]]. She has three distinct designs depending on her Ascension level:

* [[mysterious heroine xx (first ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]] is her wearing a [[full armor]] [[exoskeleton]].
* [[mysterious heroine xx (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]] loses some of the armor to show her face, and she wears a large [[blue scarf]], [[skin tight]] clothes under her armor, and metal gloves and boots.
* Third Ascension loses the armor completely, and she wears a blue [[baseball cap]], a [[white bikini]], [[strappy heels]], and a blue [[shrug (clothing)|]].

Mysterious Heroine XX wields [[Twinmyniad (fate)|]], a double-bladed version of [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]]. Her breasts get [[medium breasts|slightly]] [[large breasts|larger]] with each Ascension, though never as big as [[Artoria Pendragon (lancer) (fate)|]].

Personality-wise, she's an older, more mature version of Heroine X (and also fills the role of being a swimsuit version of her).  She's nowhere near as obsessed as X is with eliminating all the other Sabers, to the point that she sometimes forgets about it completely, and is more focused on eliminating Foreigners. In-universe, she's a Galactic Police officer, but more or less abandons her post to go to Chaldea after the events of the 2018 summer event (2020 for North America).

While her First and Second Ascensions are given character tags, her Third Ascension bikini and shrug is considered her 'default' costume and thus has not been given a tag.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BUNBUN]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: cnoc_na_riabh_(fate)
body:
A figure who appears in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the leader of the King Clan of Fae in the northern territory of Edinburgh in the Lostbelt, said to be the clan responsible for all of the world's discord and conflict. She greatly resembles [[Medb (fate)|]] but with [[small breasts]], and her name [i]Cnoc na Riabh[/i] refers to the hill in the Irish province of Sligo where Medb's Tomb is located.

A playable Foreigner-class swimsuit version was introduced in the [[Servant Summer Festival! 2023]] event, known as [b]Cnoc na Riabh Yaraan-doo[/b], with Yaraan-doo being the "Aboriginal":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aboriginal_Australians name for the [[Crux (constellation)|]] [[constellation]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takayama Kisai]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sakura Ayane]]

title: lancelot_(fate/grand_order)
body:
A Saber-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity.

One of the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]]. [spoiler]An ideal version of [[Berserker (fate/zero)|Fate/Zero's Berserker]] before he went mad after being pardoned by [[saber (fate)|his king]] for his affair with [[Guinevere (fate)|]].[/spoiler] He wears [[purple armor|purple]] or [[white armor]] and has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]].

Often paired with [[Mash Kyrielight]] [spoiler]since the latter was fused with Galahad, who is the son of Lancelot.[/spoiler]

title: edward_teach_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Also known as "Blackbeard", the most notorious pirate in history who was known for his purported ruthlessness and his brutal death. He appeared in the Third Singularity "Okeanos".

In-game, Teach is depicted as a [[pervert]] and has strong [[otaku]] vibes, visible in several quotes in the game (in which he mentions several [[Visual Novel]] tropes), his final ascension art, and as well as several memetic references.

title: merlin_(fate/prototype)
body:
The version of [[Merlin (fate)|]] from the universe of [[Fate/Prototype]]. According to this universe's [[Arthur Pendragon (fate)|Saber]], this Merlin is actually female. 

She makes a vocal cameo in [[Fate/Grand Order]] when Prototype Arthur uses his Noble Phantasm. Amusingly she is voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]], who voices Artoria (and her variants). 

She later made her first playable debut in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]] in September 2020, establishing an official design.

In summer 2022, Prototype Merlin became a summonable [[lady avalon (fate)|Pretender-class Swimsuit Servant]] in [i]Fate/Grand Order[/i] itself, going under the alias [b]Lady Avalon[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Taiki (luster)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: hans_christian_andersen_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant of [[Sessyoin Kiara]] in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] based on the Danish author of the same name.

He appears as a child who has messy blue hair and wears a formal outfit. Albeit he has an adult voice due to him intentionally manifesting that way to remind himself of his childhood and forget about his chaotic adult life.

Gains an [[hans christian andersen (adult) (fate)|adult version]] in the Summer 2020 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Koyasu Takehito]]

title: gaius_julius_caesar_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of [[Julius Caesar]], the dictator of Rome and a general who made a name for himself in the Gallic Wars and the Britannia Expedition and his contribution to the rise of what would have later become the Roman Empire.

Caesar is depicted as being [[fat]] in-game, with him claiming it to be the result of him being "not properly summoned" and thus not at his peak performance, though his extremely gluttonous diet would seem to suggest otherwise. [[Cleopatra (fate)|]] is his wife, and she is always insistent about him losing weight.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Shimadoriru]]
[b]Voice Actor[/b]: [[Okiayu Ryoutarou]]

title: boudica_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Boudica is a famous Celtic queen who led her tribe in an ultimately failed war against the invading Romans. Despite this, she is known as the "Queen of Victory" in her homeland of the United Kingdom, an epithet that she despised.

She has [[red hair]] and [[aqua eyes]]. Her first ascension is a peculiar [[white bikini]]-esque outfit, while she would gradually gaining more clothing in each ascensions.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Aotsuki Takao]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

title: saber_lily
body:
A non-canonical alternate costume of [[Saber (fate)|]] playable in the [[Fate/Unlimited Codes]] fighting game for the PS2 based on [[Fate/stay night]]. She also appeared in the Type-Moon OVA [[Carnival Phantasm]], along with [[Phantas-Moon]], [[Magical Amber]], and [[Kaleido Ruby]]. 

She is basically [[Saber (fate)|]] as a [[magical girl]] with a strong [[lily (flower)|lily]] motif, though not in a literal sense.

As of the release of [[Fate/Grand Order]], she has gotten an official story, where she is Saber during her earlier days, still wielding [[Caliburn (fate)|]] and just beginning to walk the path of a king. She was still an inexperienced knight, looked  like an adorable lily, and her eyes brimmed with shining hope. To experience many things, she traveled the land and engaged in many adventures. The people she saved in his time came to call her in past of the Knight Princess, for her brilliance and beauty.

Saber Lily is treated as a separate character from Saber, so do not add the [[Saber (fate)|]] tag if she is by herself. It's only applicable if both characters are together in the image.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: charlotte_corday_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A figure from the French Revolution who assassinated Jean-Paul Marat and was subsequently executed by [[Charles-Henri Sanson (fate)|]] on the [[guillotine]] for her crime.

She first appears in the opening animation for Part 2 of Fate/Grand Order before being released as a playable servant during the 5th anniversary. Before her name was revealed, fans gave her the nickname [b]Tawawa Assassin[/b] (たわわのアサシン), due to her striking resemblance (both her face and her [[large breasts|breast size]]) to [[Ai-chan (tawawa)|]] from the [[Getsuyoubi no Tawawa]] series.

She is accompanied by a mysterious yellow [[creature]] she refers to as an angel, resembling an egg with [[feathered wings]] and a [[halo]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Aotsuki Takao]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Horie Yui]]

title: circe_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[Salem (fate/grand order)|]] chapter as the [b]Caster of Okeanos[/b]. title: europa_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first seen during the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Europa is one of [[Zeus (fate)|]]' consorts, and the mother of King Minos (whose wife mated with the Cretan bull and gave birth to [[Asterios (fate)|]]). Zeus was so enamored by Europa that he transformed himself into a tame white [[bull]] and managed to abduct her to Crete, where she became queen. The [[robot animal|robotic]] bull she rides into battle is not Zeus himself, but rather a look-alike based on his appearance as a bull.

In the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt, [spoiler]remnants of Zeus' wife [[Hera (mythology)|]] becomes fused with Europa in order to prevent her death. Since Zeus wasn't as considerate as his proper human history counterpart, Europa chooses to defect from him and assist [[Novum Chaldea]] in defeating him.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[redjuice]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ichimichi Mao]]

title: romulus_quirinus_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A version of [[Romulus (fate)|]] with his full Divinity unleashed. He is first seen in the second half of the Greek Lostbelt, [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]]. [spoiler]There, [[Caligula (fate)|]] uses himself as a vessel for Romulus' Divinity, allowing him to be summoned as Grand Lancer.[/spoiler]

He considers himself to have ascended beyond gender as an ultimate being.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Koyama Hirokazu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Okiayu Ryoutarou]]

body:

Due to being summoned without [[Artemis (fate)|]]'s interference, he appears as a [[muscular male|muscular]] human instead of a [[teddy bear]]. The lights on his belts represent the [[Orion (constellation)|constellation of Orion]].

title: taisui_xingjun_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class welfare Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A Chinese mythological god said to be the deified form of "Tai Sui":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tai_Sui, a planet that mirrors Jupiter. The [[Chinese zodiac]] is based on divisions of Jupiter's orbital cycle rather than the Sun's in the Western zodiac, so Taisui is able to define whether any given year will be lucky or unlucky by using the 12 zodiac signs multiplied by the five Chinese elements (fire, earth, metal, water, and wood), or 60 divisions.

In Fate/Grand Order, he is created by the fusion of countless [[Con (fate)|]]. He usually appears in a child form, only changing to his [[Taisui Xingjun (Adult) (fate)|adult form]] when using his [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]], as he considers himself too dangerous to stay in his adult form as a god of misfortune regularly.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Take (takegarou)|]]
[b]Voice Actor (Child):[/b] [[Minami Omi]]
[b]Voice Actor (Adult):[/b] [[Kawanishi Kengo]]

title: witch_bandora
body:
Witch Bandora is a villain in [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]]. She was once the Queen of the Dall Tribe, who sold her soul to Dai-Satan for the power to avenge her son Kai, who was killed by a Tyrannosaurus for breaking its eggs. Unfortunately, in doing so she lost all memory of Kai, leading her to wage war on the other tribes and drive the dinosaurs to near-extinction before the Guardian Beasts sealed her and her followers away on the planet Nemesis. Years later, [[After 10000 Years I'm Free (meme)|a group of astronauts would unwittingly release them]], leading to Bandora resuming her mission to turn Earth into a barren wasteland, but was opposed by the Zyurangers, who had been put in magical stasis to awaken and protect the earth in the event of Bandora's escape.

Her counterpart in ([[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers|Mighty Morphin]]) [[Power Rangers]] is Rita Repulsa. Originally portrayed by Soga Machiko in both shows, albeit dubbed over by Barbara Goodson in Mighty Morphin, with Machiko even recording new scenes for the series' first two seasons (the footage often being referred to as "Zyu1.5":[https://www.grnrngr.com/zyu1.5/] & "Zyu2":[https://www.grnrngr.com/zyu2/]), before being replaced by Carla Perez that season, giving [[Lord Zedd]] a love potion and 'aging herself down slightly' as to marry him in that continuity.

Rita Repulsa would also appear in the 2017 [[Power Rangers (Movie)|]] movie reboot, potrayed as the original [[Green Ranger (movie)|]] before becoming Rita.  

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: Witch Bandora":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5078259
* "RangerWiki: Rita Repulsa":https://powerrangers.fandom.com/wiki/Rita_Repulsa

title: kyouryuu_sentai_zyuranger
body:
The 16th installment of the [[Super Sentai]] franchise. 

Introduces the concept of a sixth ranger to the team, as well as fantasy elements in Super Sentai, diverging away from the more science-fiction oriented elements of the previous series, and serving as a "blueprint":[https://twitter.com/cosmoserenata/status/1948489641390129370] for installments to come.

Also notable for being the first Super Sentai series to be adapted into [[Power Rangers]] for international audiences outside of Japan, in the form of [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]].

h4. Characters

* [[Yamato Zoku Prince Geki]] / [[Tyranno Ranger]]

body:
Can imply one of two things:

2. Slowing removing clothing that has been adhered to a character, such as [[pasties]].

title: solarpunk
body:
A [[science fiction]] genre and art/social movement based around sustainability, eco-friendliness, and optimism, with "solar" coming from solar energy.

Depictions of the genre often feature the coexistence of futuristic technology and nature, and the use of technology to aid nature. It serves as a foil/contrast to the [[Cyberpunk]] movement, focusing primarily on the image of a utopia rather than a dystopia.

Futuristic [[city|cities]] full of [[plant]] life, [[solar panel]]s and [[wind turbine]]s, influence from Bohemian aesthetics, [[glass]], natural colors, [[sunflower]]s, cultural diversity, and [[recycling symbol|recycling]] are all common themes and imagery in the genre.

Characters in solarpunk settings are often depicted wearing loose-fitting work clothing in earthy tones and/or white, often with lots of straps or buckles. Elements of the [[hazmat suit]] are sometimes incorporated, as are [[gas mask]]s and [[respirator]]s, [[gloves]], and [[boots]]. Flowy, patterned fabric is also common, as is influence from [[techwear]] shape-wise.

h4. Notable works

* [[Arknights]] (imagery)
* [[Genshin Impact]]'s Sumeru
* [[Kaze no Tani no Nausicaa]] (themes)
* [[Overwatch]]'s Numbani
* [[Tenkuu no Shiro Laputa]]
* [[Wall-E]] (themes)

h4. See also

* [[Biopunk]]
* [[Cyberpunk]]
* [[Dieselpunk]]
* [[Silkpunk]]
* [[Steampunk]]
* [[Frutiger Aero]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Solarpunk":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solarpunk
* "Aesthetics Wiki: Solarpunk":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Solarpunk
* "TV Tropes: Solar Punk":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SolarPunk

title: science_fiction
body:
A genre of fiction which centers around futuristic science and technology. 

Space travel, [[robot]]s and [[alien]]s, and/or complex [[machine]]ry are common aspects of this genre. Use this tag for images which appear to be set inside of a science fiction universe. 

Scifi and [[fantasy]] often intersect, so feel free to use both tags if you feel it is appropriate.

title: frostpunk
body:
A 2018 city-building/survival video game by 11 Bit Software, creators of [[This War Of Mine]], set in a [[steampunk]]/alternate history late-19th Century where the player is tasked with setting up and maintaining a city during a worldwide mass-cooling event. Frostpunk proved incredibly popular, and was the subject of Let's-Plays by several Youtubers including [[Ouro Kronii]].

A sequel, [[Frostpunk 2]], was released in 2024.

title: steampunk
body:
A genre of [[science fiction]] set in Victorian times when steam was the main source of machine power. Common visual elements include, but are not limited to:

* [[victorian|Victorian fashion]], especially [[top hat]]s and for women, [[corset]]s or elaborate [[gown]]s
* Accessories such as [[goggles]], [[pocket watch]]es, [[belt pouch]]es, and [[test tube]]s
* [[Machinery]] with [[industrial pipe]]s, [[steam]], and lots of [[gears]]

h4.Notable Steampunk franchises

* [[Final Fantasy VI]]
* [[Fullmetal Alchemist]]
* [[Frostpunk]] 
** [[Frostpunk 2]] 
* [[Fushigi no Umi no Nadia]]
* [[howl's moving castle (novel) |Howl's Moving Castle]]
** [[Howl no Ugoku Shiro]]

[td]じゃー[/td]
[td](1) *flowing water* *rush*;

[td]ジロジロ[/td]

[td]*stare~~~* *stare*
*stare stare*[/td]
[td]Impression that you are staring at something because you are or want to examine it further.  It has caught your attention. Note: "jiro jiro miru" or「じろじろ見る」 literally means "to stare." In Japan, this is considered rude behavior.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]jita bata[/td]
[td]ジタバタ[/td]

(2) when one is trying to resist something being done to them by force (being tied up).[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]jito-[/td]
[td]ジトー[/td]
[td]じとー[/td]
[td]*stare*[/td]
[td]In the sense that something has caught your attention and you can't take your eyes off it.  It can be intentional or unintentional.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]jitto[/td]
[td]ジット[/td]
[td]じっと[/td]
[td](1) *watch*
*stare*
*staring*;
(2) *standing still*
*frozen*
*stuck wandering in*
*trying to bear it*[/td]
[td](1) This is a short form of the Japanese version of "rude staring" or 「じろじろ見る」;
(2) To be stuck in a phase or condition, Ex: "Even if it's painful, you must bear with it".[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]jiwa[/td]

title: frutiger_aero
body:
Frutiger Aero is a visual aesthetic primarily utilized in the 2000s to early 2010s for commerical purposes, focusing on the mix of nature with technology, as well as an overall "glossy" look.

The name, coined by the Consumer Aesthetics Research Institute, originates from the "Aero" style from [[Windows 7]], and the Frutiger font.

Color palettes tend to consist of whites, blues and greens, and the occasional orange. Glossy textures are very common, as are semi-transparent elements. [[Lens flare]]s and [[bokeh]] are also frequently seen, along with "swirly" freeform shapes.

Common thematic elements include colorful [[tropical fish]] and other marine life (often jumping out of a body of shimmering blue [[water]]), [[glass]], bright green [[grass]], [[bubble]]s, the [[aurora]] phenomenon, [[blue sky|blue skies]], technology of the time period (i.e. [[flip phone]]s, 2000s [[computer]]s, [[digital media player]]s), and contemporary and retrofuturistic architecture.

h4. Examples

* !post #7016487 
* !post #3078769
* !post #755036
* !post #754662

h4. See also

* [[Frutiger Metro]]
* [[Vaporwave]]
* [[Solarpunk]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Frutiger Aero":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frutiger_Aero
* "Aesthetics Wiki: Frutiger Aero":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/Frutiger_Aero
* "Frutiger-Aero.org":https://frutiger-aero.org/frutiger-aero

title: silkpunk
body:
A [[science fiction]] genre influenced by Asian-Pacific culture and "punk"-type genres, like [[cyberpunk]] and [[steampunk]]. 

Initially coined by writer Ken Liu to describe his series, "Dandelion Dynasty", it mixes the aesthetics of Asian-Pacific culture and the themes commonly found in genres like steampunk.

For an post to qualify, it should feature enough East Asian elements, while still being science fiction.

h4. See also

* [[Biopunk]]
* [[Cyberpunk]]
* [[Dieselpunk]]
* [[Steampunk]]
* [[Solarpunk]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

h4. External links
* "Ken Liu, Writer - What is “Silkpunk”?":https://kenliu.name/books/what-is-silkpunk/

title: dieselpunk
body:
Also called [b]Decopunk[/b], A genre of [[science fiction]] set typically between [[World War I]] or [[World War II]] and the start of the Cold War, with petroleum-based fuels starting to dominate transportation and industry. It tends to focus on a brutalist and often art deco aesthetic, and is seen as a continuation of the styles and themes explored in the [[steampunk]] genre.

h4. Notable Dieselpunk franchises

* 9
* [[Bioshock (series)|]]
* [[Iron Harvest]]

title: biopunk
body:
A genre of [[science fiction]]/[[horror (theme)|]] and is the literary sister genre of [[cyberpunk]], focusing on the use of biological technology and its effects on society. Usually very "meaty" in style with grotesque imagery, raw sexual motif, [[guro]], [[living clothes]], [[tentacles]], [[exposed muscle]] and [[body horror]] being common visual staples. With the intention to fascinate the viewer with the exotic yet familiar imagery and make them feels uncomfortable at the same time.

In terms of aesthetics, pure biopunk art can typically be divided into two main styles: Style A which typically merge machinery and organics (think a computer with an organic brain) or style B which has the organics take over the role of machinery (think that the whole computer is made of organic matter).

h4. Notable Biopunk franchises

* [[Alien (1979)|]]
* [[Angel at Dusk]]

title: yume_kawaii
body: Literally, "dream cute". Not necessarily cute as in [[tag group:subjective|subjective]] cuteness, but rather a specific aesthetic theme meant to give off the feeling of a floaty, dream-like environment that is conducive to emphasizing cuteness. Bright [[pastel colors|pastels]] and nostalgic appropriation of visual elements from [[retro artstyle|retro]] shoujo manga and anime are common motifs of the aesthetic. Yume Kawaii is also a fashion style, sometimes also referred to as "Fairy Kei" (overseas) or "Fancy" (in Japanese). h4. Examples * !post #7843071 * !post #7817972 * !post #7873550 * !post #7851746 h4. See also * [[Decora]] * [[Heisei Retro]] * [[Yami Kawaii]] * [[Tag Group:Fashion style]] * [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: yami_kawaii
body:
Yami Kawaii (meaning "sick cute") is an aesthetic that has been bubbling out of [[Tokyo (city)|]]'s streets and manifests through accessories such as fake [[gun]]s, [[syringe]]s, [[gas mask]]s, [[pill]]s, [[bandages]] and [[bandaid]]s.

Sometimes called Menhera Kei.

h4. See also
* [[Gurokawa]]
* [[Goth fashion]]
* [[Jirai Kei]]
* [[Punk]]
* [[Yume Kawaii]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: squat_(exercise)
body: [[Squatting]] done for [[exercising|exercise]]. Difficulty may be increased by using a [[barbell]], which makes it a [[weightlifting]] movement.

title: vaporwave
body:
A retro-styled music and art genre that gained popularity in the 2010s. Commonly features references to 1980s and [[cyberpunk]] aesthetics, [[Windows 95]], [[neon palette|harsh pink/cyan tones]], and has plenty of Japanese text.

h4. See also

* [[Synthwave]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: synthwave
body:
A retro-styled music and art genre that grew in the 2010s.

The 1980s, [[wireframe]] 3DCG, purple, orange, [[sunset]]s, [[driving]] in a [[car]], [[palm tree]]s, huge [[building]]s, glaring logos, etc. are often used as motifs.

It is easy to get confused with [[vaporwave]] because it has some overlaps.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: surreal
body:
Art, (and sometimes literature) that attempts to express the workings of the subconscious. Usually characterized by fantastic imagery and incompatible or inconsistent things placed together, resulting in a oddly dreamlike image or story.  

h4. See Also

* [[Abstract]]
* [[Optical illusion]]
* [[What]]
* [[Liminal space]]
* [[Weirdcore]]
* [[Tag Group:Image composition]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: bench_press
body: A [[weightlifting]] exercise where a person presses a [[barbell]] upwards while lying on their back. The bench press is considered one of the three powerlifting exercises, alongside the [[deadlift]] and the [[squatting|squat]].

title: weightlifting
body:
A type of [[exercising]], mostly done at the [[gym]], where the person lifts heavy [[weights]], such as [[dumbbell]]s and [[barbell]]s.

h6. Weightlifting Exercises
* [[bench press]]
* [[deadlift]]
* [[clean and jerk]]
* [[squat (exercise)]] 

h4. See also

* [[weightlifting spotter]]
* [[push-ups]]
* [[sit-up]]

title: heisei_retro
body:
Aesthetic and fashion style based around nostalgia for the [[Heisei]] period, primarily featuring elements associated with '90s and 2000s Japanese childhood, especially that of young girls and the clothing that was marketed to them during the time. It is closely related to [[Yume Kawaii]] and [[Y2K fashion]]. In the West, it is often referred to as "cutecore".

Common themes include [[chibi]] [[animal]]s and mythical creatures such as [[unicorn]]s, [[rainbow]]s, [[bokeh]] and [[sparkle]]s, [[sticker]]s, [[charm (object)|]]s, colorful plastic [[jewelry]], [[randoseru]], sweet food such as [[fruit]] and [[cake]], bright [[pastel colors]], shaped [[hairclip]]s and [[hair bobbles]], [[magical girl]] themes, and symbols such as [[heart]]s, [[star (symbol)|]]s and [[musical note]]s.

Brands like [[Mezzo Piano]] and [[Angel Blue]] are popular, as are [[Sanrio]] characters and [[Tamagotchi]], and [[flip phone]]s, especially with [[cellphone charm]]s.

For specifically [b]adults[/b] wearing children's clothing, see [[jojifuku]]. (Do keep in mind, however, that the 女児服 tag is often used for both concepts on sites like Pixiv.)

h4. Examples

* !post #9202732
* !post #8644168
* !post #8397662
* !post #417853

h4. See also

* [[Heisei]]
* [[Yume Kawaii]]
* [[Jojifuku]]
* [[2000s (style)]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: gurokawa
body:
Fashion style and visual aesthetic that is often conflated with [[yami kawaii]] due to both focusing on mixing cute elements with creepy ones. 

The key difference is that gurokawa evolved from [[decora]] and focuses on gory imagery, while yami kawaii evolved from [[yume kawaii]] and focuses on medical imagery. Gurokawa was popularized by [[Kyary Pamyu Pamyu]] in the 2010s.

Common visual motifs include dripping prints, eyeballs, bones and skeletons, and traditional halloween imagery like bats or ghosts.

h4. See also

* [[Yami Kawaii]]
* [[Candy gore]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: dunhuang_style
body:
[b]Dunhuang style[/b] refers to the art, fashion, and culture depicted in the Dunhuang Murals of China, which are located in the Mogao Caves in Dunhuang, Gansu Province. Outfits following Dunhuang style are often inspired by "Feitian"/"apsara":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apsara] – beautiful flying celestials in [[Buddhism]] who are skilled in music and dance. These costumes typically consist of items like [[bandeau]], [[pants]], and [[shawl]] that are influenced by [[Indian clothes]].

H4. Examples

* !asset #25875601: Art from the Dunhuang caves 

h4.See also

* [[Dunhuang dance]]
* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]
* [[Tag Group:Fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "What exactly does Dunhuang style mean?":[https://ziseviolet.tumblr.com/post/672232299973296128/what-exactly-does-dunhuang-style-mean]

title: blingee
body:
Blingee, founded 2006, was an online tool for the creation of animated GIFs which allowed users to decorate pictures with user-generated stamps up until the product's discontinuation in June 2024. In popular culture Blingee and the flashy, neon style of its stamps have become closely associated with early internet aesthetics. Particulary artwork which attempts to mimic art styles that were popular [[2000s (style)|during the mid to late 2000's]].

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":[https://blingee.com/]
* "Wikipedia: Blingee":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blingee]

title: kaguya_(persona_4)
body:
It is a type of persona that appears in [[Persona 4 the Golden]]. It is based on the motif of [[Kaguya Hime]].
 
In [[Persona 4: The Ultimax Ultra Suplex Hold]] , it is used by [[Marie (Persona 4)|]].

title: abstract
body:
Unlike the strictly artistic term, on Danbooru abstract isn't the antonym to figurative. Rather, this tag is for images that make use of a lot of abstract style techniques, such as scattered paint or shapes, or strange hypnotic patterns and colors.

h4. See Also
* [[Surreal]]

title: weirdcore
body:
Aesthetic centered around combining nostalgic imagery with ominous, surreal or dreamlike elements.

This most often manifests as late 90s/early 2000s nostalgia, with images often looking like they were taken by early digital cameras. These are then edited with text or imagery (eyes, shadows) to unnerve the viewer or imply an unsafe, surreal, or all around "weird" enviorment.

Sometimes overlaps with [[liminal space]]s and the [[Backrooms (creepypasta)|]] in terms of subject matter, but may also overlap with [[Frutiger Aero]] or other web aesthetics when evoking nostalgia.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Visual aesthetic]]

title: cerberus_(megami_tensei)
body:
A reoccurring demon in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] franchise. The standard version resembles a white male lion with a serpent's tail.

Cerberus is also the Persona of [[Koromaru (persona)|]] in [[Persona 3]].  There, he resembles a three-headed [[dobermann]] with pitchforks for feet.

title: doujima_nanako
body:
Major supporting character from [[Persona 4]]. [[Narukami Yu]]'s cousin.

Because her father, [[Doujima Ryoutarou|Ryoutarou]], is always busy working with the police, Nanako has had to mature quickly. Initially shy around new people, Nanako quickly warms up to Yuu, begins to call him "big bro", and eventually starts taking part in the gang's outings around Inaba. Her social link is [b][[Justice (tarot)|]][/b].

Has a fascination with the local Junes.

In the Japanese Persona community, fans of Nanako are nicknamed [i]Nanakon[/i] (ナナコン).

title: shigure_ui_(vtuber)_(casual)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Shigure Ui (vtuber)|]]'s VTuber avatar.

It's a matching outfit with [[Oozora Subaru]]'s [[oozora subaru (casual)|casual costume]], and just like it, is a [[virgin killer outfit|virgin killer]]/[[french girly]]-inspired costume consisting of a [[white headwear|white]] [[beret]], a [[green dress|green]] [[plaid dress|plaid]] [[underbust]] [[pinafore dress]] that [[framed breasts|frames her breasts]] worn over a [[frilled shirt]] with [[center frills]], a [[yellow sweater|yellow]] [[aran sweater]], a [[white pantyhose]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]].

She has [[official alternate hair length|longer hair]] with this outfit, with her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] being [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair]] with a [[side braid]] that turns into a [[one side up]] or [[twintails]].

title: ninomae_ina'nis_(school_uniform)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ninomae Ina'nis]].

It is a [[school uniform]] that consists of a [[grey shirt|light grey]]/[[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[black bowtie]], a [[v-neck]] [[grey sweater]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[platform shoes]], she also has an optional [[black coat|black]] [[double-breasted]] [[long coat]] with [[lapel pin]]s and a [[medical eyepatch]] on her left eye hiding a [[pink eyes|pink]]/[[purple eyes|light purple]] [[glowing eye]], giving her a [[chuunibyou]] aesthetic.

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[short hair|short]]/[[medium hair|medium]] [[parted hair]] with a [[side ponytail]] and [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]].
