body:
A Demon Lord Digimon, evolved from of [[Lucemon]]. Lucemon Falldown Mode resembles a large blonde man with twelve wings on its back - six white feathered wings on its right, and six black batlike wings on its left. It is one of the Seven Great Demon Lords, representing the sin of Pride, and its title is "Paradise of Loss" (消失の楽園, [i]Shoushitsu no Rakuen[/i]). Evolves into [[Lucemon Satan Mode]].

Lucemon Falldown Mode is referred to as [b]Lucemon Chaos Mode[/b] in English material.
other_names: ルーチェモンフォールダウンモード

title: iron_throne
body:
The iconic [[throne]] depicted in the fantasy novel series [i][[A Song of Ice and Fire]][/i] by [[George R.R. Martin]] and its associated TV show [i][[Game of Thrones]][/i]. Said to be forged from the swords of Targaryen ruler Aegon the Conqueror's enemies and fused by dragonfire.

The throne as depicted in the TV show has been accepted as the definite version and a symbol for the entire media franchise, despite not being the one in George R. R. Martin's imagination, one that is tall, large enough to fill most of a room, having stairs, and being haphazardly made, which would be too expensive and too large to feasibly recreate in reality, let alone be used in even the largest indoor sets for the TV series. [[Marcsimonetti|Marc Simonetti]]'s Throne (post #6286993) has been described to be the closest to Martin's vision.

h4. Further reading:
* "Wikipedia: Iron Throne ([i]A Song of Ice and Fire[/i])":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Throne_(A_Song_of_Ice_and_Fire)]

title: shanghai.exe:_genso_network
body:
A [[Mega Man Battle Network (Series)|]]-inspired [[Touhou]] fangame by Technodot. The story follows the ordinary student [[Alice Margatroid|Alice Shiki]] and her [[NetNavi]] [[Shanghai.EXE]].

Despite having released, the game was shut down by [[Capcom]]. The source code was leaked, but the game, although beatable, is not fully completed as originally intended.

title: yanfei_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character. A half-human, half-iluminated beast who works as a well-known legal adviser active in Liyue Harbor. 

Yanfei never signed a contract with Rex Lapis even being half-Adeptus since she was born during peacetime.

Her name is pronounced [b]Enhi[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

Yanfei has [[orange hair]] and eyes that are either [[green eyes|green]] or [[aqua eyes|aqua]]. She wears a [[red hat]] called a [[xiezhi guan]]. Her outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] top that is [[crop top|cropped]] to show her [[midriff]], with [[detached sleeves]]. She wears a [[red skirt]] over [[black shorts]] on her lower half, along with [[red footwear|red]] [[high heel boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4552046: Profile

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Yanfei":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Yanfei]

title: yaoyao_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Dendro [[Genshin Impact]] character.

She was [[Xiangling (genshin impact)|]]'s junior disciple under the same master chef, but has since become an assistant for [[Ganyu (genshin impact)|]]. She currently resides in Liyue Harbor as a disciple of [[Madame Ping (Genshin Impact)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: sayu_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character. A ninja of the Shuumatsuban in Inazuma. She's said to be the laziest due to her habit of sneaking out to sleep and skip work because she wants to grow taller. Despite this, she's still a very capable ninja.

She wields a claymore in battle and possesses an Anemo Vision. It is said that her Anemo Vision grants her enough power to wield the claymore in battle, else she wouldn't even be able to lift it.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4692952: Profile

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Sayu":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Sayu]

title: super_bunyan_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class variant of [[Paul Bunyan (fate)|]] introduced in [[Mississippi Mythicizers]]. She appears [[aged up|older]] than her Berserker self, only to return to her usual height (if not shorter) in her third ascension. Her hat conceals a pair of [[rabbit ears]], and if she leaves her hat off for too long, she also grows [[antlers]], making her resemble a [[jackalope]].

As an Alter Ego servant, her heroic spirit components include [[Rider (learning with manga! fgo)|]], [[Assassin (learning with manga! fgo)|]], and [[Mike Fink (fate)|]]. [spoiler]"Nanabozho":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nanabozho snuck in as part of Mike Fink, who eroded her spirit origin, causing him to manifest in her place, only mimicking her soul. Unfortunately for him, Super Bunyan's personality had a stronger ego and self-interest than his, so he in turn became sealed away inside her psyche. If Bunyan ever manages to find peace of mind within herself, Nanabozho will resurface and completely take over, resulting in the complete erasure of Bunyan's personality.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Riyo (lyomsnpmp)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Omigawa Chiaki]]

title: trung_nhi_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. [[Trung Trac (fate)|]]'s sister and partner, appearing together as a single Saber-class Servant. The Trung sisters (also known as Hai Bà Trưng, 'Two Ladies Named Trưng') were Vietnamese military leaders who ruled for three years after rebelling in AD 40 against the first Chinese domination of Vietnam, and are regarded as national heroines of Vietnam.

Trung Nhi has blue-tinted hair, yellow eyes (green in her third ascension), and has [[dark-skinned female|darker skin]]. She is supposedly the younger of the two. Her name is stylized as [b]Trưng Nhị[/b].

title: weird_route_(deltarune)
body:
[b]Weird Route[/b] (also referred as Snowgrave Route by the fandom or internally as Side B) is a hidden alternate path in [[Deltarune]] which can be triggered during Chapter 2. The route begins after [[Noelle Holiday]] joins the party in Cyber City. [spoiler]It is considered to be a spiritual successor to [[undertale|Undertale's]] "[[Genocide Route (Undertale)|]]".[/spoiler]

[spoiler]To initiate it, the player must backtrack with Noelle toward the Trash Zone, then defeat all enemies using only her "IceShock" spell. The player obtains the “FreezeRing” through a scripted purchase event, then replaces it with the “[[Thorn Ring (Deltarune)|ThornRing]],” which reduces the TP cost for IceShock and lowers Noelle's HP to one third of her maximum. Equipping it changes Noelle's title to "Ice Trancer" with the description [i]"Receives pain to become stronger."[/i][/spoiler]

[spoiler]The route culminates in a boss fight against [[Berdly (deltarune)|]], where the player can force Noelle to use a new spell, “[[Snowgrave (spell)|]]”. After this point, the route becomes locked for the remainder of the chapter. The [[Queen (deltarune)|]] fight becomes inaccessible, and [[Spamton NEO]] replaces her as the final boss.[/spoiler]

Save files that complete Chapter 2 via this route are flagged and will trigger altered scenes and dialogue in Chapters 3 and 4. The route is resumed and further consolidated during the Chapter 4.

Not to be confused with [[tate_no_yuusha_no_nariagari_rise|Shield Hero: RISE]]

title: gainax
body:
[b]Gainax Company, Limited[/b] (株式会社ガイナックス, [i]Kabushiki-gaisha Gainakkusu[/i]) was a Japanese anime studio famous for works such as [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]], [[Top Wo Nerae!]], [[fushigi no umi no nadia|Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water]], [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], [[FLCL]] and [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] which have gone on to critical acclaim and commercial success, as well as for their association with award-winning anime director and studio co-founder [[Anno Hideaki]]. The company was headquartered in Koganei, Tokyo, before moving to Mitaka, Tokyo.

The studio was formed in the early 1980s as [[Daicon]] Film by university students [[Anno Hideaki]], [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]], Yamaga Hiroyuki, [[Akai Takami]], Okada Toshio, Takeda Yasuhiro, and [[Higuchi Shinji]]. Their first project was to make an animated short for the 20th Annual Japan National SF Convention, also known as [[Daicon III]], held in 1981 in Osaka, Japan. The group made a much bigger splash at the 22nd Annual Japan National SF Convention, [[Daicon IV]], in 1983.

The Daicon IV short firmly established Daicon Film as a talented new anime studio. The studio changed its name to Gainax in 1985, basing the term 'Gainax' on an obscure Tottori Prefecture term for 'giant' and the English suffix 'x'.

Since Gainax originated as a group of fans, it was known for maintaining ties to the general [[otaku]] community, allowing doujinshi of its work, fan-made action figures, and promoting series like Evangelion at private festivals and so on.

Until Neon Genesis Evangelion, Gainax typically worked on stories created in-house, but the studio increasingly developed anime adaptations of existing manga like [[Kareshi Kanojo no Jijou]] and [[Mahoromatic]].

The Animage Anime Grand Prix has been awarded to Gainax for Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water in 1991, Neon Genesis Evangelion in 1995 and 1996, and [[The End of Evangelion]] in 1997.

Much of Gainax's former staff and series left Gainax starting in the late 2000s; notably Anno Hideaki formed [[Studio Khara]] and obtained the rights to Evangelion, several staff members (including those involved in [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]]) left to make [[Trigger (company)|Studio Trigger]], and Gainax sold their rights to FLCL to I.G. Production. [[gonzo (studio)|Gonzo]] is also made of former Gainax staff, having left in the early 90s.

On May 29, 2024, Gainax filed for bankruptcy with the Tokyo District Court, which was publicly announced over one week later on June 7. The remainder of its properties were split between the various Gainax splinter companies and former staff previously mentioned.

body:
A character speaking a single or a chain of w's in the end of their sentences.

In Japanese internet slang, "www" represents laughter. It comes from 笑 ([i]Wara[/i], meaning "laugh"). The English language equivalent would be to speak "lol" out loud.

Note that this does not necessarily mean the character is [[laughing]].

title: asgore_dreemurr
body:
A character in [[Undertale]] and [[Deltarune]], a father of [[Asriel Dreemurr|Asriel]] and [[Toriel]]'s ex-husband. He is portrayed as a humanoid goat-like monster with two large curved horns and a golden-blond mane and beard.

In Undertale, he takes on the role of the King of Monsters, tasked to collect the human souls in order to destroy the barrier between the surface and the underground.

In Deltarune, he acts as the father of [[Kris (Deltarune)|Kris]] and Asriel, and the owner of a flower shop. [spoiler]He was also the chief of the police force, but due to an unknown incident, he was removed from the team.[/spoiler]
other_names: アズゴア・ドリーマー

title: asriel_dreemurr
body:
A character in [[Undertale]] and [[Deltarune]] and the son of [[asgore dreemurr|Asgore]] and [[Toriel]], Asriel resembles a humanoid goat-like monster, and is primarily seen wearing a green and yellow striped shirt and black pants as portrayed in Undertale.

In Undertale, [spoiler]he died long before the events of the game and reincarnated as [[flowey (undertale)|Flowey]] due to [[Alphys]] injecting Determination into one of the golden flowers that happened to contain his essence. During the "True Pacifist" route of the game, he takes on the role of the final boss as the [[Asriel Dreemurr (God Of Hyperdeath)|God of Hyperdeath]] after absorbing everyone's souls.[/spoiler]

In Deltarune, he was mentioned multiple times throughout the story, though he has yet to make an appearance until after a week in the game's setting since he is studying for college.
other_names: アズリエル・ドリーマー

title: kopi_luwak
body: A type [[coffee]] from [[Indonesia]] made from coffee beans that were eaten and defecated by Asian palm civets. While fans of kopi luwak claim the coffee has a unique taste due to being fermented in the Civet's intestines, others argue the coffee is nothing more than a gimmick and just taste bad, especially since it was made from coffee beans that were pooped by a animal. Not helping the coffee's reputation is it's expensive price and criticism of farmers caging and forcing Civets to eat the coffee beans.

title: yuki_judai
body:
AKA: Jaden Yuki (English dub)

Main protagonist from [[Yu-Gi-Oh! GX]], as well as the reincarnation of the [[Supreme King (yu-gi-oh! Gx)|]]. He is headstrong, optimistic, fun loving, and a talented Duelist who loves Dueling as much as he cares for his friends. At the end of the third season, he fused his soul with [[Yubel]], his childhood ace card, with [[Super Polymerization]] to become a Duel Monster-Human hybrid.

Attends the Duel Academy in the Slifer Red Dorm, and uses a deck composed of Elemental Hero with [[Elemental Hero Neos]] as his ace card, and [[Winged Kuriboh]] as his Duel Monster spirit partner.

title: cel_240
body: IB-01: CEL 240 A boss in [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]] and a Coral-powered C-weapon developed by the Rubicon Research Institute. This metalic silver coloured autonomous craft is both humanoid and bird-like in appearance with two sets of double flared shoulder armours and [[reverse-jointed legs]], utilises its high mobility and remote controlled weaponry in combat. CEL 240 attacks with Coral based weaponry both melee and ranged, houses 12 Coral Orbit remote weapons in its extended flared shoulder armor in a similar manner to how the [[qubeley|AMX-004 Qubeley]]/[[kshatriya|NZ-666 Kshatriya]] uses '[[funnels (gundam)|Funnels]]' from [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. It is said CEL 240's appearance and combat style is a direct reference to the Qubeley, and its ability to resurrect after first defeat together with its extravagant attack move sets is also a reference to [[malenia goddess of rot|Malenia]] from [[Elden Ring]], another FromSoftware title. Due to the lack of voice lines mentioning its actual name and rather hard name for native Japanese speakers to remember, Japanese fans often call it with one of the following names: * アイビスシリーズ (Ibis Series), the name mentioned in the boss fight, which is actually a subseries of C-Weapons it belongs to (others being [[SOL 644]] and [[HAL 826]].) * Or the fan nickname of ルビコニアンデスキュベレイ (Rubiconian Death Qubeley), as a reference to [[ice_worm_(armored_core_vi)|IA-02 Ice Worm]]'s fan nickname ルビコニアンデスワーム (Rubiconian Death Worm). Nicknaming Ibis Series also extends to SOL 644 and HAL 826, both of which are usually called with their pilots.
other_names: ルビコニアンデスキュベレイ

title: marina_(splatoon)
body:
[[Splatoon 2]] character. Named [b]Iida[/b] in the Japanese version. She is an [[Octoling]].

She is part of the band Off The Hook (Tentacles in the Japanese version) with [[Pearl (splatoon)|]], which has its own television show.

Her default costume & appearance features a black [[crop top|cropped]] [[cropped vest|vest]], [[green pantyhose|green]] / [[aqua pantyhose]] under [[black shorts]], black [[boots]] and black [[fingerless gloves]]. She has a [[navel piercing]] and a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]]. She has [[green eyes|green]] / [[aqua eyes]], often depicted with [[red pupils]] as [[cephalopod eyes]]. She often wears [[headphones]]. She is often depicted with a [[furrowed brow]] / [[raised eyebrows]].

Her Japanese name comes from the word for the "webfoot octopus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amphioctopus_fangsiao (イイダコ [i]Iidako[/i]). As revealed in [i]Octo Expansion[/i], her full name is [b]Marina Ida[/b] in English; [b]Marine Iida[/b] ([b]Iida-Marine[/b], [b]イイダ=マリネ[/b]) in Japanese.

title: jelleton
body:
Mechanical sea creatures that serve as the enemies for the [[Splatoon 3]] DLC, [[Splatoon 3: Side Order|Side Order]]. They have design motifs of being [[fish skeleton|skeletal]], coated in black gelatin and having [[red eyes]].

h4. Types

[b]Common[/b]
* !asset #22864070: [[Battering Lento]]

title: lily_(artist)
body:
Artist whose website was closed in January, 2010. Frequently drew [[Naruto (classic)|]], specifically Itachi or other Akatsuki.
It was "rumored":http://www.peeep.us/2af13d9d that "an illustrator called Sasagami (笹上)":http://www.amazon.co.jp/dp/4062559218/ was lily's another pseudonym, but there's no clear evidence.

title: mine_laru

title: utau
body:
UTAU is a free singing synthesizer program that was developed to use wave files that could be put together to simulate singing. UTAU is best known for letting people create their own voice banks by the use of their own voice. 

The UTAU voice banks are often personified into characters called UTAUloids. This became popular after [[Kasane Teto]], a former [[VOCALOID]] joke character, became known as an UTAU. 

[b]UTAU isn't [[VOCALOID]][/b] and shouldn't be confused with or tagged as such (and vice versa).

h4. List of tagged UTAUloids

title: mami_mogu_mogu
body:
Posts with explicit reference to [spoiler]the death scene of [[Tomoe Mami]][/spoiler] in Episode 3 of [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i].

[spoiler]The scene involves an apparently victorious Mami having her head chomped and [[decapitation|decapitated]] by the [[witch (madoka magica)|]] [[Charlotte_(madoka_magica)|]]'s true form. This scene acts as a plot twist due to the first two episodes depicting a typical lighthearted magical girl story, whereas the rest of the story would gradually turn into a gritty dark fantasy.[/spoiler]

The general depictions are:

* [spoiler]A body hanging in the air with the head out of frame.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Charlotte_(madoka_magica)|]]'s mouth is wide open, ready to chomp somebody.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Tomoe Mami|Mami]] loses or having lost her head, one way or another.[/spoiler]

This tag is loosely translated into [spoiler]"Mami chomp"[/spoiler], with "mogu mogu" as the onomatopoeia for [spoiler]chewing.[/spoiler] The name came from the runes appeared during "Charlotte's labyrinth scene":https://images.puella-magi.net/8/86/Episode_3_runes.jpg.

Because of the nature of this tag, please add the {{spoilers}} tag as appropriate.

The related Japanese terms are:

* マミる (Mami-ru, to be Mami'd)
** Nicopedia article: http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4557586 
** Verbs of this form may be transitive or intransitive; e.g. 取る is transitive and 判る is intransitive.  Both of the Japanese wiki articles cited indicate that マミる is an intransitive verb.
* マミられる (Mami-rareru, to be Mami'd; alternate & much less common version)
* マミった (Mami-tta, has been Mami'd; past tense of Mamiru)
